title: ITC shares now trade ex-hotels; Check stock price post demerger - CNBCTV18
summary:
ITC Shares Trade Ex-Hotels; Current Stock Price Adjusted Post-Demerger

Date: Jan 6, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

ITC Ltd's market price has been set at ₹455.60 following a special trading session as its hotels arm separates from the conglomerate, which includes cigarette and FMCG businesses.

The company’s stock opened at ₹26 lower, reflecting the expected adjustment for the hotel business as listings for ITC Hotels are anticipated by mid-February. Shareholders will receive an equity share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares of ITC held post-demerger.

  • Market assigned ITC shares a price of ₹455.60 on January 6, 2025.
  • Shares opened ₹26 lower than the previous close after the company went ex-hotel business.
  • Shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares held.
  • Analysts expect a listing price for ITC Hotels between ₹100-125.
  • SBI Securities predicts a net profit of ₹546 crore for ITC Hotels in FY 2025.
  • ITC Hotels aims to expand to over 200 hotels by 2030.
“We are expecting the listing to be on or before Feb 2025...” - Prashanth Tapse, Mehta Equities

The demerger is expected to enhance shareholder value and strengthen the focus on the luxury hospitality sector. Investors are encouraged to hold onto their shares to benefit from this transition.
newTitle: ITC Shares Trade Ex-Hotels; Current Stock Price Adjusted Post-Demerger

“The second part capacity of 30 MW out of 150 MW Gujarat Solar PV Project… is declared on commercial operation,” stated the company's regulatory filing.

The ongoing projects and investment agreements signal growth for NTPC Green Energy, indicating a proactive position in the renewable energy sector.

title: Union Bank of India shares fall 7% after weakest business update so far amongst all lenders - CNBCTV18
summary:
Union Bank of India Shares Plummet 7% Following Weakest Business Update

Date: January 4, 2025
Source: CNBC TV18

Union Bank of India's latest business update reveals a decline, causing shares to fall significantly.

  • Shares dropped 7% after the release of the quarterly business update.
  • Deposits increased by 3.8% year-on-year, but fell 2% from the previous quarter.
  • Advances growth was 5.9% year-on-year, totaling ₹9.49 lakh crore.
  • Total business slightly declined by 0.24% quarter-on-quarter but rose 4.7% year-on-year to ₹21.65 lakh crore.
  • Currently trading at ₹115.67, down 6.7%.
“Union Bank's performance has shown weaknesses in key growth areas, leading to a significant market response.”

The quarterly update raises concerns about Union Bank's performance relative to other lenders, pointing towards potential ongoing challenges.
newTitle: Union Bank of India Shares Plummet 7% Following Weakest Business Update

title: Easy Trip Planners shares surge up to 17% after Nishant Pitti confirms 'no further stake sale' - CNBCTV18
summary:
Easy Trip Planners shares surge up to 17% after Nishant Pitti confirms 'no further stake sale'

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

Shares of Easy Trip Planners Ltd., the parent company of online travel aggregator EasyMyTrip, surged by 17% following confirmation that there would be no further stake sales from its promoters.

  • Nishant Pitti confirmed via social media that he will not sell any further stake in the company.
  • He explained that the small percentage of stake sold last week was due to personal requirements.
  • Despite the stake sale, Pitti assured that he retains a 14.2% stake in the company.
  • Nishant Pitti stepped down as CEO but remains as Chairman, while Rikant Pittie was appointed the new CEO.
“Exciting times ahead for @EaseMyTrip! As Chairman, I’ll focus on shaping our future and driving international expansions, while Rikant steps in as CEO to lead day-to-day operations and driving our vision forward.” — Nishant Pitti

With cash reserves of ₹400 crore, the company appears poised for investment in the travel sector, further solidifying its market position.
newTitle: Easy Trip Planners shares surge up to 17% after Nishant Pitti confirms 'no further stake sale'

Publication Date: Jan 4, 2025 11:37 AM IST

Source: CNBCTV18

Shares of Suzlon Energy Ltd. are expected to be in focus during Monday's trading session due to a recent Income Tax demand of ₹1.01 crore for FY17.

  • Income Tax demand is related to late payments regarding employee contributions to PF/ESI during FY 2016-17.
  • Suzlon Energy plans to appeal the penalty.
  • The Income Tax Department previously waived off a penalty of ₹260.35 crore.
  • Suzlon's stock has gained over 60% in the last 12 months.

Overall, the developments suggest that while Suzlon Energy is facing new financial challenges, the company has previously had penalties waived, indicating potential for resolution.

title: BSE, NSE to hold special session for ITC-ITC Hotels demerger: What we know - Business Standard
summary:
BSE and NSE Prepare for ITC-ITC Hotels Demerger on January 6, 2025

Date: January 6, 2025

Source: Business Standard

Monday, January 6, 2025, is the record date for ITC shareholders to determine eligibility for shares of ITC Hotels following its demerger that took effect on January 1, 2025.

  • The ITC stock undergoes a pre-open session for price discovery.
  • Eligible shareholders will receive ITC Hotels shares based on their existing holdings.
  • The ITC stock will remain part of the indices for three trading days.
  • ITC retains a 40% stake in the new entity, distributing the remaining 60% to shareholders.
  • ITC Hotels shares are expected to list by mid-February 2025.
  • Early expiration for all ITC Futures and Options contracts related to the demerger.
“This move allows ITC Hotels to focus on growth in the luxury hospitality sector while maximising shareholder returns.”

This demerger represents a strategic shift for ITC, aiming to enhance shareholder value and business focus.
newTitle: BSE and NSE Prepare for ITC-ITC Hotels Demerger on January 6, 2025

Indo Farm Equipment Ltd is set to debut on the NSE and BSE on January 7, following a strong investor response during its IPO bidding period.

  • Non-institutional investors subscribed at 503.83 times, while qualified institutional buyers (QIBs) subscribed at 242.40 times.
  • The retail investors' quota was 104.92 times subscribed.

title: OpenAI is beginning to turn its attention to ‘superintelligence’ - TechCrunch
summary:
OpenAI is beginning to turn its attention to 'superintelligence'

Publication Date: Late Sunday Evening
Source: TechCrunch

OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman has announced a shift in focus towards developing 'superintelligence,' which he believes could drastically enhance scientific discovery and innovation.

  • OpenAI claims to know how to build artificial general intelligence (AGI).
  • Altman envisions superintelligent tools accelerating scientific advancements.
  • He believes superintelligence could be just a few thousand days away.
  • OpenAI’s definition of AGI includes highly autonomous systems that outperform humans at most economically valuable work.
  • Despite the optimism, Altman acknowledges the current limitations of AI technology.
“Given the possibilities of our work, OpenAI cannot be a normal company.” - Sam Altman

Ultimately, while Altman remains confident in overcoming current AI challenges, he stresses the need for careful handling of the implications of superintelligent systems.
newTitle: OpenAI's Focus Shifts Towards Superintelligence

title: Debt mutual funds may get tax relief on capital gains - The Financial Express
summary:
Debt Mutual Funds Seek Tax Relief on Capital Gains

Date: Not specified Source: Financial Express

The mutual fund industry is advocating for the reintroduction of indexation benefits for capital gains on debt-oriented funds, potentially to be announced in the upcoming Budget FY26. This comes as current returns have diminished due to inflation.

  • The government may favorably consider the reintroduction of indexation benefits, previously withdrawn in Finance Bill 2023.
  • The mutual fund industry requests a long-term capital gains tax rate of 12.5%, similar to that for listed bonds.
  • Investments made in debt funds prior to April 1, 2023, lost the indexation advantage due to recent budget changes.
  • Industry executives stress that indexation is a necessary tool to counterbalance inflation's impact on returns.
“While the ministry’s intention was tax simplicity, withdrawing indexation benefit for debt MF inadvertently introduced tax uncertainty. Reinstating it would not only restore investor confidence but also promote tax equality among various financial instruments.” – Neeraj Agarwala, partner, Nangia & Co.

The mutual fund sector is focused on lobbying the government to align tax policies favorably towards long-term investments to enhance investor confidence and participation in capital markets.
newTitle: Debt Mutual Funds Seek Tax Relief on Capital Gains

NPS systematic withdrawal plan suits retirees with large corpus - The Times of India
summary:
NPS Systematic Withdrawal Plan Benefits Retirees

Publication Date: Recently | Source: Times of India

The National Pension System (NPS) offers a systematic withdrawal plan particularly beneficial for retirees with a substantial corpus.

  • The systematic withdrawal plan allows retirees to withdraw funds periodically instead of a lump sum.
  • This mechanism aids in financial planning by ensuring a steady income stream post-retirement.
  • Retirees can customize their withdrawal frequency and amount based on their needs.
  • This option is particularly advantageous for those with larger retirement savings, enabling better cash flow management.
“The systematic withdrawal plan is tailored to meet the diverse financial needs of retirees, providing flexibility and security.”

The NPS's systematic withdrawal plan not only secures financial stability for retirees but also encourages a more strategic approach to managing retirement funds.
newTitle: NPS Systematic Withdrawal Plan Benefits Retirees

title: Dai-ichi Life Takes ¥140 Billion Loss Selling Off Long Bonds | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Dai-ichi Life Takes ¥140 Billion Loss Selling Off Long Bonds

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Bloomberg

Dai-ichi Life Insurance Co. incurred a loss of approximately ¥140 billion ($890 million) by selling long-term bonds in anticipation of rising interest rates. The company sold ¥500 billion in Japanese government bonds, primarily of longer maturities, in the first half of the fiscal year.

  • The sales were concentrated in the first half of the fiscal year, with plans for more restrained activity in the second half.
  • President Toshiaki Sumino assured that the loss would not impact the company's financial soundness.
  • Dai-ichi Life holds ¥18.9 trillion in yen-denominated bonds.
  • Sumino predicts a rate hike by the Bank of Japan due to the economy showing signs of recovery.
  • The company is focused on replacing sold assets while being mindful of profit impacts.
  • Annualized premiums from new contracts rose significantly in the first half of fiscal 2024, marking a recovery from previous scandals.
“I don’t think the loss will have any impact on our financial soundness,” said Sumino.

Overall, Dai-ichi Life is navigating the challenges posed by the changing interest rate environment while also working to rebound from past setbacks.
newTitle: Dai-ichi Life Reports Loss from Long Bond Sales Amid Interest Rate Preparations

title: Chinese hack of US telecoms compromised more firms than previously known, WSJ says - The Economic Times
Indian-origin founder clueless after selling $975 million firm: ‘No idea what to do’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Indian-origin founder clueless after selling $975 million firm: ‘No idea what to do’

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Vinay Hiremath, co-founder of Loom, expressed confusion after selling his startup for $975 million, revealing his struggles with newfound wealth and direction in life.

  • Hiremath sold Loom to Atlassian for $975 million in 2023.
  • He shared his thoughts in a blog post, detailing feelings of aimlessness despite financial freedom.
  • He apologized to his ex-girlfriend, reflecting on personal insecurities affecting his relationships.
  • He considered starting a robotics company but felt uninspired by the idea.
  • Hiremath attempted to work for Elon Musk, describing it as a valuable experience.
  • After an ill-fated expedition in the Himalayas, he is currently in Hawaii learning physics to build a foundation for future ventures.
“After selling my company, I find myself in the totally un-relatable position of never having to work again.”

Hiremath’s journey highlights the emotional challenges that can accompany sudden wealth and the search for purpose beyond financial success.
newTitle: Indian-origin founder clueless after selling $975 million firm: ‘No idea what to do’
